subject: Baseball
Statistics
organizations: Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania
lead_paragraph: Two economists at the Wharton School have found that hitters on the cusp of batting .300 for a season succeed well beyond normal in their final at-bats of the season.
snippet: Two economists at the Wharton School have found that hitters on the cusp of batting .300 for a season succeed well beyond normal in their final at-bats of the season.
